Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraperitoneal Hyperthermic Chemoperfusion with Oxaliplatin for Peritoneal Surface Malignancy

Trial_Design.evidence: Cohorts of three patients underwent cytoreductive surgery followed by a 2-hour IPHC with escalating doses of oxaliplatin

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults with peritoneal dissemination from colorectal or appendiceal cancers.

Intervention.evidence: Cohorts of three patients underwent cytoreductive surgery followed by a 2-hour IPHC with escalating doses of oxaliplatin

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to establish the dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) and maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of oxaliplatin in IPHC for colorectal and appendiceal cancer dissemination.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was DLT, defined as grade 3 toxicity lasting 5 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifteen patients were enrolled at two dose levels.

Result_Outcome.evidence: DLTs at 250 mg/m² were observed in two of three patients. The MTD was determined to be 200 mg/m².

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were significant at 250 mg/m², precluding higher doses.
